text: The system shall capture and maintain demographic information as discrete data elements as part of the patient record.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall store medication information in discrete data fields.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall provide the ability to capture patient history in a standard coded form.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall provide templates for inputting data in a structured format as part of clinical documentation.
label: USABILITY

text: The system shall display patient annotations in a manner which distinguishes them from other content in the system.
label: USABILITY

text: The system shall enforce the most restrictive set of rights or privileges or accesses needed by users or groups (e.g. System Administration, Clerical, Nurse, Doctor, etc.), or processes acting on behalf of users, for the performance of specified tasks.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall have the ability to format for export recorded time stamps using UTC based on ISO 8601.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall authenticate the user before any access to Protected Resources (e.g. PHI) is allowed, including when not connected to a network e.g. mobile devices.
label: SECURITY

text: When passwords are used, the system shall support password strength rules that allow for minimum number of characters, and inclusion of alpha-numeric complexity.
label: SECURITY

text: The system upon detection of inactivity of an interactive session shall prevent further viewing and access to the system by that session by terminating the session, or by initiating a session lock that remains in effect until the user reestablishes access using appropriate identification and authentication procedures.
label: SECURITY

text: The inactivity timeout shall be configurable.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall enforce a limit of (configurable) consecutive invalid access attempts by a user.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall protect against further, possibly malicious, user authentication attempts using an appropriate mechanism (e.g. locks the account or node until released by an administrator, locks the account or node for a configurable time period, or delays the next login prompt according to a configurable delay algorithm).
label: SECURITY

text: When passwords are used, the system shall provide an administrative function that resets passwords.
label: SECURITY

text: When passwords are used, user accounts that have been reset by an administrator shall require the user to change the password at next successful logon.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall provide only limited feedback information to the user during the authentication.
label: SECURITY

text: When passwords are used, the system shall allow an authenticated user to change their password consistent with password strength rules (SC 03.02).
label: SECURITY

text: When passwords are used, the system shall use either standards-based encryption, e.g., 3DES, AES, or standards-based hashing, e.g., SHA1 to store or transport passwords.
label: SECURITY

text: When passwords are used, the system shall prevent the reuse of passwords previously used within a specific (configurable) timeframe (i.e., within the last X days, etc. e.g. last 180 days), or shall prevent the reuse of a certain (configurable) number of the most recently used passwords (e.g. last 5 passwords).
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall include documentation that explains system error or performance messages to users and administrators, with the actions required.
label: USABILITY

text: The system shall include documentation of product capacities (e.g. number of users, number of transactions per second, number of records, network load, etc.) and the baseline representative configurations assumed for these capacities (e.g. number or type of processors, server or workstation configuration and network capacity, etc).
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The system shall include documentation available to the customer stating whether or not there are known issues or conflicts with security services in at least the following service areas: antivirus, intrusion detection, malware eradication, host-based firewall and the resolution of that conflict (e.g. most systems should note that full virus scanning should be done outside of peak usage times and should exclude the databases.)
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall include documentation that itemizes the services (e.g. PHP, web services) and network protocols/ports (e.g. HL-7, HTTP, FTP) that are necessary for proper operation and servicing of the system, including justification of the need for that service and protocol.
label: SECURITY

text: This information may be used by the healthcare facility to properly configure their network defenses (firewalls and routers).
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall include documentation available to the customer that provides guidelines for configuration and use of the security controls necessary to support secure and reliable operation of the system, including but not limited to: creation, modification, and deactivation of user accounts, management of roles, reset of passwords, configuration of password constraints, and audit logs.
label: SECURITY

text: The software used to install and update the system, independent of the mode or method of conveyance, shall be certified free of malevolent software (malware).
label: SECURITY

text: Vendor may self-certify compliance with this standard through procedures that make use of commercial malware scanning software.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall support protection of confidentiality of all Protected Health Information (PHI) delivered over the Internet or other known open networks via encryption using triple-DES (3DES) or the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) and an open protocol such as TLS, SSL, IPSec, XML encryptions, or S or MIME or their successors.
label: SECURITY

text: For systems that provide access to PHI through a web browser interface (i.e. HTML over HTTP) shall include the capability to encrypt the data communicated over the network via SSL (HTML over HTTPS).
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall support ensuring the authenticity of remote nodes (mutual node authentication) when communicating Protected Health Information (PHI) over the Internet or other known open networks using an open protocol (e.g. TLS, SSL, IPSec, XML sig, S or MIME).
label: SECURITY

text: The system, when storing PHI on any device intended to be portable or removable (e.g. thumb-drives, CD-ROM, PDA, Notebook), shall support use of a standards based encrypted format using triple-DES (3DES), or the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES), or their successors.
label: SECURITY

text: The system, prior to access to any PHI, shall display a configurable warning or login banner (e.g. "The system should only be accessed by authorized users").
label: SECURITY

text: In the event that a system does not support pre-login capabilities, the system shall display the banner immediately following authorization.
label: SECURITY

text: The system has capability to use visual cues to highlight abnormal results.
label: USABILITY

text: The system will need the support capability of up to and beyond 5000 default schedules.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: There is no limitation to the number of accepted formats.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The system shall be based upon proven state-of-the-art technologies.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: This includes browser-based, server-side architectures, configurable, and a range of industry-standard database, operating system, and programming platforms.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system, including programs, database, and ancillary hardware and related software systems shall be able to retain its performance levels when adding additional users, functions, and data.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The system shall be scalable and adaptable to meet future growth and expansion needs.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The solution functionality and associated business rules shall be configured and re-configured (through tools that do not require code modifications).
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The screens shall be highly re-configurable, providing ability to reposition and rename field labels, remove or “turn-off” unused fields, maintain data, and allow addition of custom-defined fields.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall use an open relational database management system (RDBMS) to store all organization data.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The database system shall provide Structured Query Language (SQL) capabilities for database queries.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall allow the database information exchange using current commonly accepted industry formats (e.g. HL7, XML).
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall support common database connectivity protocols such as ODBC.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall provide an automated test script to validate the data after modifications or upgrades.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The tool will support the ability to customize the script and provide a final report to document the validation.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The database system shall provide the following features:
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall support an online data dictionary and table relationships that describe and maintain information on each data element including: data element name and type, description of the data element, and the format of each data element.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall utilize naming conventions and standards for data elements, entities and tables, programs, report names, etc.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall utilize utilities for database performance monitoring and tuning that comply with industry standards, including but not limited to tools for table & file maintenance.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall support online modifications to database structures with minimal user downtime.
label: AVAILABILITY

text: The system shall provide the ability to load information from standard file(s).
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall provide the ability to perform real-time updates.
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: The system shall provide ability to use a single user sign-on for all modules with security configured for each module.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall have the ability for security module to be maintained by an in-house System Administrator
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall provide expiration dates for passwords.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall automatically notify users and force them to change passwords on a pre-defined frequency.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall have the ability to support web based client access or other internet based client access technologies, with appropriate security access controls.
label: SECURITY

text: System must support password complexity that meets the following requirements:
label: SECURITY

text: Disable accounts after 90 days of inactivity
label: SECURITY

text: System provides the following password change rules for user accounts:
label: SECURITY

text: Passwords can be changed by the associated user only once in a 2-day period
label: SECURITY

text: Users are re-authenticated before changing passwords
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall provide lock-out capability after a pre-defined number of unsuccessful user sign-on attempts.
label: SECURITY

text: The password is not displayed as clear text (Password Masking)
label: SECURITY

text: System provides integrated security managed in a central accounts database
label: SECURITY

text: System allows viewing of list of Users logged on to System in real-time
label: SECURITY

text: System allows addition of user-defined messages to logon screen
label: SECURITY

text: System performs secure and seamless logon for all third party integrated systems.
label: SECURITY

text: System encrypts passwords before being stored or transmitted.
label: SECURITY

text: System has the ability to disallow more than one active session per sign-on identification.
label: SECURITY

text: System allows users to re-authenticate and remotely log out of an active user session before logging in at another location.
label: SECURITY

text: System encrypts sensitive data transmitted between clients and servers using Secure Socket Layer (SSL) Certificates, Transport Layer Security (TLS), or by other means
label: SECURITY

text: System provides a web (HTTPS) interface and provides an SSL configuration mechanism.
label: SECURITY

text: System allows secure password resets in case passwords are forgotten.
label: SECURITY

text: System provides reminder alerts to users to reset passwords.
label: SECURITY

text: The time for passwords to be changed is predefined as per user’s role and access level.
label: SECURITY

text: The County standard for users is 90 days.
label: SECURITY

text: System provides the option for multi-factor authentication for users with higher security access.
label: SECURITY

text: Ability for an administrator to delegate authority, by user group, to reset password
label: SECURITY

text: Ability for an administrator to delegate authority, by user group, to restore system access of locked out user
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall have the ability to display the last date and time the user logged onto the system at the time of logon.
label: SECURITY

text: System insures that input validation is applied whenever input is received through user or external data interfaces.
label: SECURITY

text: The validation approach is to constrain, reject, and then sanitize input.
label: SECURITY

text: System does not rely on client-side validation.
label: SECURITY

text: The System design assumes that user input is malicious.
label: SECURITY

text: Data is validated for type, length, format, and range.
label: SECURITY

text: Data validation is consistent across the System.
label: SECURITY

text: System avoids un-trusted input of file name and file paths.
label: SECURITY

text: System does not accept file names or file paths from calling functions.
label: SECURITY

text: Security decisions are not made based on user-supplied file names and paths.
label: SECURITY

text: System does not use parent paths when data within the System is being accessed.
label: SECURITY

text: Attempts to access resources using parent paths are blocked.
label: SECURITY

text: The web server always asserts a character set: a locale and a country code, such as en_US.
label: SECURITY

text: All system and user accounts are identified.
label: SECURITY

text: Web sites are partitioned into un-restricted and restricted areas using separate folders.
label: SECURITY

text: System uses least-privileged accounts.
label: SECURITY

text: System insures that minimum error information is returned in the event of authentication failure.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall have the ability to support biometrics and biometrics plus passwords (e.g., fingerprint scan and fingerprint scan plus password).
label: SECURITY

text: System authenticates the user before any access is allowed to protected resources (e.g., Protected Health Information)
label: SECURITY

text: System authenticates standalone devices before access is allowed to protected resources.
label: SECURITY

text: If Structured Query Language (SQL) authentication is used (e.g., communication between the application server and the database server) credentials are secured in storage and over the wire via Secure Socket Layer (SSL) or IP Security (IPSec).
label: SECURITY

text: Administration interfaces require strong authentication and authorization.
label: SECURITY

text: Remote administration channels are secured (e.g., SSL, VPN)
label: SECURITY

text: Configuration credentials and authentication tokens are not held in plain text in configuration files.
label: SECURITY

text: User accounts and service accounts used for configuration management have only the minimum privileges required for the task.
label: SECURITY

text: Sensitive data and secrets are not incorporated in code.
label: SECURITY

text: Secrets are stored securely using a one-way hash.
label: SECURITY

text: Database keys, connections, passwords, or other secrets are not stored in plain text.
label: SECURITY

text: Sensitive data is not logged in clear text by the System.
label: SECURITY

text: Database or file encryption for protection of sensitive data fields while the data is at rest (i.e., stored data) is provided.
label: SECURITY

text: Protection mechanisms are in place for sensitive data that is sent over the network.
label: SECURITY

text: Sensitive data is not transmitted using insecure protocols, such as FTP, telnet, tftp etc., unless tunneled through an authenticated encrypted connection (e.g. VPN).
label: SECURITY

text: Sensitive data is not stored in persistent cookies.
label: SECURITY

text: All user sessions involving financial transactions or sensitive data are encrypted using SSL/HTTPS.
label: SECURITY

text: SSL is used to protect authentication cookies.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall provide automatic logout of users when there has been no activity for a pre-defined period, maintaining transaction integrity.
label: SECURITY

text: Session lifetime is limited to a pre-specified and configurable duration.
label: SECURITY

text: Session state is protected from unauthorized access.
label: SECURITY

text: Session identifiers are not passed in query strings.
label: SECURITY

text: Temporary objects are removed from the system, database connections are closed, and memory is released.
label: SECURITY

text: System provides an automatic timeout if the session is idle for a pre-specified and configurable duration.
label: SECURITY

text: System warns the user before the timeout and prompts the user to re-enter their password.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall have the ability to support 128-bit SSL encryption, or higher, between the client browser and the application tier for any or all modules or sub-modules at organization discretion.
label: SECURITY

text: Identify security standard (SSL or FIPS encryption).
label: SECURITY

text: Encryption capability for certain data transmissions that require security protection.
label: SECURITY

text: Platform-level cryptography is used with no custom implementations.
label: SECURITY

text: System provides secure information delivery over the Internet via encryption by using triple-DES (Data Encryption Standard) or the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES)
label: SECURITY

text: Encrypted data delivered over the Internet is transmitted via open protocols (e.g., SSL, XML encryption)
label: SECURITY

text: Cryptographic algorithm and key size for the System’s data encryption requirements is AES 256 bit or stronger.
label: SECURITY

text: Encryption keys are secured.
label: SECURITY

text: Key management procedure to secure and manage the encryption keys is defined.
label: SECURITY

text: All input parameters are validated (including form fields, query strings, cookies, and HTTP headers).
label: SECURITY

text: Cookies with sensitive data (e.g. authentication cookies) are encrypted.
label: SECURITY

text: Sensitive data is not passed in query strings or form fields.
label: SECURITY

text: Security decisions do not rely on HTTP header information.
label: SECURITY

text: System exception handling minimizes information disclosure in case of an exception.
label: SECURITY

text: System returns generic error messages to the client, to avoid disclosure of sensitive information.
label: SECURITY

text: System code does not rely on internal system generated error handling.
label: SECURITY

text: The System provides error-handling processes.
label: SECURITY

text: Private and sensitive data (for example, passwords) are not logged.
label: SECURITY

text: The system shall have a customizable online documentation and training materials such as context-specific help, search capability, organization-specific business process documentation and process maps.
label: USABILITY

text: The Proposer shall allow for field level edit checks for transactions during data entry and provide immediate user feedback, including error messages and possible corrective actions
label: USABILITY

text: The system shall have the ability to design a preferred sequence to make data-entry columns and fields match the order of information in organization source documents.
label: USABILITY

text: The system shall allow for the option of auto-fill capability per transaction or field entry throughout all modules
label: USABILITY

text: The system shall have the ability to restrict free form entry (e.g., provide drop down calendar for date field)
label: USABILITY

text: On-line, interactive help with support for hyperlink technology and industry standard formats (e.g., HTML file formats)
label: MAINTAINABILITY

text: Intelligent spell checking of text fields
label: USABILITY

text: The system shall present data to users such that a minimum of navigational effort is required, including:
label: USABILITY

text: The data elements required to complete a job function, whether to inquire or read only or data entry must be readily available.
label: USABILITY

text: The user interface shall integrate information from multiple components into a unified display by business area or work type.
label: USABILITY

text: The system shall be able to handle an average transaction load with an average CPU utilization of no more than 35%-40% of the CPU capacity.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The peak CPU utilization shall never exceed 70% of CPU capacity at any given time.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The system shall have a response time where the average transaction on the server needs to occur on average less than 1 second.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The response time for the most common requests to reach a user shall not exceed 3 seconds.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The solution shall maintain 99.9% availability — including planned maintenance.
label: AVAILABILITY

text: The solution shall track system uptime and transaction response times in order to demonstrate operation within acceptable levels.
label: AVAILABILITY

text: The solution shall complete 100% of simple, single-screen online inquiry transactions in under one second, during peak usage.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The solution shall complete an average of 99% of all online update transactions in under 5 seconds over any 60-minute period, during peak usage.
label: PERFORMANCE

text: The Proposer shall test application enhancements, fixes, and upgrades and assure the integrity of the resulting data.
label: MAINTAINABILITY
